articles.summary: Duolingo is using artificial intelligence to boost the productivity of its employees. It hasn't laid off a full-time employee since its founding in 2009 and has added headcount since April. The company has a market capitalization of $12.73 billion as of Wednesday afternoon.

articles.title: How smart brands are delivering Netflix-level personalization with AI
articles.author: Beatrice Daily Sun

articles.title: AI's Ability To Displace Jobs is Advancing Quickly, Anthropic CEO Says
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned that AI's ability to displace humans at various tasks is accelerating. Up to half of white-collar jobs could be wiped out by AI in the next five years. Government intervention is needed to support the workforce.

articles.title: Expanding Artificial Intelligence in Washington Schools: State Seeks $10 Million for Educational Advancements
articles.summary: Washington State is seeking $10 million to expand the integration of artificial intelligence in its K-12 education system. $4 million is dedicated to professional development for Washington State teachers. $3 million is for purchasing and deploying AI-powered educational software and platforms across various school districts. $1 million is reserved for pilot programs exploring innovative uses of AI in special education, especially for students with learning disabilities and accessibility needs.

articles.title: Is the internet's next chapter making us lonelier?
articles.author: Scott Rada
articles.summary: Episode 212: Artificial intelligence has moved from science fiction to everyday life, embedded in chatbots, search engines and social media feeds. Richard Kyte and Scott Rada discuss how chatbots are shaping relationships, education and mental health. Kyte argues that artificial intelligence should be tightly controlled until its effects are understood.

articles.title: Is the internet's next chapter making us lonelier?
articles.author: Scott Rada
articles.summary: Richard Kyte and Scott Rada discuss how chatbots are shaping relationships, education and mental health. Kyte argues that artificial intelligence should be tightly controlled until its effects are understood. Rada pushes back, noting that past technologies were also greeted with skepticism before becoming indispensable.

articles.title: Exclusive: Anthropic's Claude is getting better at building itself, Amodei says
articles.author: Ben Berkowitz
articles.summary: Anthropic's Claude is writing the code to build future versions of itself. AI's ability to grow itself is accelerating exponentially, CEO Dario Amodei said at the Axios AI+ DC Summit on Wednesday. "Terminator" isn't real yet, but AI's growth is accelerating.

articles.title: The AI Frontier: NVIDIA Battles Competition While Forging New Empires

articles.summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA) is the undisputed titan of the artificial intelligence (AI) chip market. Demand for its graphics processing units (GPUs) continues to soar, fueled by the insatiable"Dell AI Factory" with NVIDIA.

articles.title: Salesforce tries to soften the blow of AI's job theft
articles.author: Stephen Council
articles.summary: Salesforce is trying to counter the threat of AI's labor replacement with a concerted push to retrain workers and aggressively rehire internal candidates. The company is filling about half of its open roles with people who already work at the company. Salesforce's emphasis on internal hiring is also a financial strategy as it's cheaper not to onboard new employees and to avoid paying millions of dollars for large layoffs.

articles.title: NC education leaders, researchers host summit geared toward navigating AI
articles.author: Brea Hollingsworth
articles.summary: Dozens gathered Wednesday inside RTI International at Research Triangle Park for a summit on AI and the ways people can shape the evolving technology. The event was held in partnership with Elon University and brought higher education leaders, practitioners, and other experts to offer their insights on the impact of AI and its influence on various industries.

articles.title: Anthropic Report Finds Dire News About AI's Effects on Job Market
articles.summary: A new report from OpenAI's competitor Anthropic shows that businesses are mainly using AI to automate their jobs. According to the report, the plurality of what businesses are using AI for is coding at 44 percent, with office and administrative tasks a distant second at 10 percent. Anthropic's CEO predicted that AI could wipe out 50 percent of entry-level white collar jobs.

articles.title: Billions in AI investment threatened by 'fundamentally unreliable' IoT connectivity, warns study
articles.author: Io T Business News
articles.summary: Poor Internet of Things (IoT) connectivity is hindering the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in a third of businesses (34%) according to the new 2025 State of IoT report from global IoT firm Eseye. The research surveyed 1,200 senior IoT decision-makers.

articles.title: Americans want AI to stay out of their personal lives
articles.author: Terrence O'Brien
articles.summary: A new study from Pew suggests that Americans aren't optimistic about the use of AI in their daily lives. Just 18 percent believe that AI should play any role at all in dating and matchmaking. Two-thirds of people want it to stay out of their love lives entirely, 73 percent believe it has no place advising people on their religious beliefs, and 18 percent worry about the spread of misinformation.

articles.title: Learning, instead of cheating, with AI
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence makes take-home tests and essays obsolete. High school and college educators in the U.S. say student use of artificial intelligence has become so prevalent that to assign writing is no longer a useful tool and it's a waste of time.

articles.summary: CrowdStrike launched a new Agentic Security Platform designed to secure AI-driven environments and bought Pangea for $260 million. CrowdStrike is at the forefront of a market many analysts see as the next major wave in cybersecurity. Crowdstrike's combination of extensive security data, operational expertise from managed services, and integrated platform architecture creates a compelling foundation for agentic security capabilities.

articles.title: Not sure how important cyber stocks are in the AI age? Listen to this story from the CrowdStrike CEO
articles.author: Paulina Likos

The Club's portfolio is invested in CrowdStrike, Palo Alto and CRWD.

A PPC agency helps smaller businesses compete with established brands by targeting niche keywords and local audiences.

articles.title: Walmart's AI-assisted distribution centers aim to cut food waste and boost profits

AI helps create the 'perfect pallet' and triangulates data from individual stores' layouts.

Since OpenAI released ChatGPT three years ago, software companies have been rolling out their AI offerings that have not been ready for prime time. MIT found that 95% of AI pilot programs fail to deliver measurable profit-and-loss impact.

articles.title: OpenAI, Anthropic usage data shows economic divide

OpenAI's models act most prominently as a Google search engine, with 18% of queries involving specific information. US dominates Claude usage, specifically in California, New York, and Virginia. Tech-focused countries like Israel and Singapore also see strong uptake relative to their working-age populations.

Google's AI app Gemini has just ascended to the top of Apple's App Store in the US and UK, blowing past ChatGPT and Meta's Threads.

articles.title: Google's Gemini goes 'nano-banana' in AI wars

The ads can appear on Amazon's online marketplace and across its other properties like Prime Video, the Kindle, and Twitch.

articles.title: Con Watch: A.I. Is Making Scams Harder to Spot
articles.author: Steve Weisman
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used by criminals to enhance their scams. Scammers are using A.I. to create persuasive communications, craft legitimate-looking retail websites, construct compelling investment scams, and make romance scams appear more credible. According to the FBI, victims are typically the elderly, women, and people who have been widowed.

It's a comprehensive agentic AI system that acts like a full service creative partner. It conducts research, generates new ideas and autonomously operates Amazon's creative tools on behalf of the advertiser.

The town will lend its branding to the marketing efforts and will be a 'lighthouse partner' in the rollout.

Now the action shifts to newspapers. Microsoft is facing similar lawsuits from The New York Times, New York Daily News, Chicago Tribune, The San Jose Mercury News, The Denver Post and Orange County Register. Newspapers in Canada and Brazil have also filed actions against OpenAI on the same grounds. Microsoft has made it clear that it plans to fight these lawsuits with a 'fair use doctrine'

It was organised by nurses and AI researchers to tackle emergency department waiting times that plague the NHS. It took place to tackle one of healthcare's most persistent challenges: Emergency Department waiting times.

articles.author: People Daily
articles.summary: Shenzhen is transforming urban healthcare through the integration of large-scale artificial intelligence. There are already 450 AI medical products implemented across the city's healthcare institutions. These devices can rapidly analyze tongue and facial features to evaluate physical conditions and health status, providing reference for lifestyle adjustments.

articles.summary: The Government will invest up to $70 million over seven years in AI research through the New Zealand Institute of Technology. The aim is to build New Zealand's AI capability, fast-track commercialisation and drive economic growth. Dr Shane Reti is the Science, Innovation and Technology Minister.

articles.title: CENTER FOR LIFELONG LEARNING: Artificial Intelligence: Fear it or embrace it
articles.author:
Vicki Gibboney
Contributor
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is here to stay. The field of AI research was founded at a workshop held on the campus of Dartmouth College in 1956. In 1974, the U.S. and British governments stopped funding undirected research into artificial intelligence. By the late 1980s, the industry had grown into a billion-dollar enterprise, but the enthusiasm waned in the 1990s. In the early 2000s, machine learning was applied to a wide range of problems in academia and industry. In 2017, deep learning proved to be a breakthrough technology. articles.summary: Luigi Mangione's first-degree murder charge was reduced to second-degree Tuesday. Mangione majored in computer science.

articles.title: WHAT'S WRONG WITH DADDY: Things AI can't do
articles.author: Jason Graves
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs predicts that artificial intelligence may displace up to 300 million jobs by 2027. articles.title: Kleiner Perkins-backed voice AI startup Keplar aims to replace traditional market research

articles.summary: Keplar is a market research startup that uses voice AI to conduct customer interviews. It raised $3.4 million in seed funding from Kleiner Perkins, SV Angel, Common Metal, and South Park Commons. The startup's platform can turn any question about the product into an interview moderation guide. The results of the interviews are packaged into reports and PowerPoint presentations.
